events.name: Kotlin For Android Workshop (PAID)
events.description:
Do not forget to get your ticket (printed or electronic) PLEASE NOTE THIS IS PAID EVENT(Just 10$)! YOU NEED TO BUY TICKETS AT:  https://www.eventbrite.com/e/kotlin-for-android-workshop-tickets-36859450609 Kotlin is the modern programming language that is now officially supported by Google for Android development.  It is our second workshop. We have learned a lot with previous one, refined lecture part, improved samples, removed server side concentrating only on Android development and tested all new updates of tools. In this 3 hour workshop, we’ll learn more about Kotlin for Android development. We are welcome all developers with any experience. Session agenda: Intro and Welcome (20 minutes) Kotlin syntax lecture(30 minutes) Kotlin Android app concept lecture (20 minutes) Creating the first screen of our Android app (40 minutes) Break (15 minutes) Advanced concepts of Kotlin for Android (40 minutes) Wrapup (10 minutes) 

If you already paid for the previous workshop - contact organizers to get a free one for this event. Pre-requisites: You should bring charged laptop with: - Android Studio 2.3.3 installed - Java Development Kit installed. Do not forget your tickets. Printed or electronic
events.location: Google Asia Pacific, 70, Pasir Panjang Road, #03-71, Mapletree Business City, Singapore 117371

events.name: First Code Academy Demo Day (Aug 19)
events.description:
Dear parents and students, 
We hope you are having fun learning coding! It's time now for our traditional Demo Day event, where graduating students are invited to showcase and talk about their very own app creations!
At First Code, we strongly believe in the power of sharing knowledge and ideas - one of our classroom rules is "I love nice people who make cools things"! Our Demo Day is a wonderful platform for students to stand proud showcase their amazing projects to family and friends.
All students, parents and friends are invited to join our Demo Day this September. There will be showcase of custom projects from all our students, plus food and games for all!
 
Demo Day Event Details

Date: August 19, Saturday
Time: 10:00am - 12:00pm
Venue: First Code Academy, #04-13 Stamford Court, 61 Stamford Road, Singapore 178892

Hope to see you there and bring your friends and family! 
 
Note: Please register separate tickets for family/friends attending and for students presenting.
If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to us at hellosg@firstcodeacademy.com
events.location: First Code Academy Singapore, #04-13 Stamford Court, 61 Stamford Road, Singapore 178892

events.name: CANCER MEDICINE: CROSSING THE BORDERS TO PERSONALISED HEALTHCARE
events.description:
Have you considered the possibility of having robots perform surgery on you, or taking a 3D-printed pill, as part of your personalised healthcare regiment?
Many such phenomena, imagined in old sci-fi movies, have become a fast approaching reality today – self-driving cars, bionic body parts, virtual reality, etc. Join Shivaji Rikka as he discusses the innovative healthcare technologies that are rapidly changing the face of cancer therapeutics and bringing personalised healthcare within reach.



This talk is brought to you by the one-north Festival 2017.
The one-north Festival 2017 is jointly organised by the Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) and the JTC Corporation, and is supported by the Singapore Science Centre.
The festival celebrates how Research, Innovation, Creativity and Enterprise are coming together in one vibrant community at one-north. This year’s theme ‘Pioneering an Innovation Future’ envisions how technologies in the one-north ecosystem play a key role in value creation.
Visitors on public days 18 and 19 August (Friday & Saturday) will be greeted with a variety of talks, interactive innovation booths and hands-on experiments for both students and families to showcase technologies in Future Work, Health and Living.

Event Details
Venue: Biopolis @ one-north Start Date: 18 August 2017 11:00 AMEnd Date: 19 August 2017 06:00 PM
events.location: Breakthrough Theatrette, Level 4, Matrix, Biopolis, 30 Biopolis St, Singapore 138671
events.group_name: A*STAR (Agency for Science, Technology and Research)

events.name: TELE-REHABILITATION: SUPERVISED THERAPY WITHIN THE COMFORTS OF HOME
events.description:
As our population ages, rehabilitation services are increasingly needed to help lighten the impact of disease and disability. For stroke patients, rehabilitation is particularly essential to get a full recovery.  However, research shows that only a third of patients regularly return for rehabilitation
Join A/P Arthur Tay as he speaks about his team’s effort to bridge the gap between patients and rehabilitation, using a tele-rehabilitation system that has been successfully tested by Ang Mo Kio Thye Hua Kwan Hospital and Singapore General Hospital. Learn how technology can provide patients with greater convenience and flexibility in the comfort of their homes.

events.name: DECODING ALLERGIES: NATURE OR NURTURE?
events.description:
When was the last time you had an allergic reaction? It could have been anything from a runny nose to something more serious. Allergies are surprisingly common in tropical Singapore, with nearly half of our population affected. What causes this high prevalence? Is it something you are born with, or do you develop it over time? How does our lifestyle affect our allergies?Come listen to Dr Anand Andiappan as he shares startling insights from years of studying how and why people develop allergies globally; and find out what A*STAR's scientists are doing to help us fight allergies better.
